63.title: "Cochinadas"
63.author: argumento de Yolanda Vargas Dulché ; dibujo S
63.appears_in: Valencia ; colab. J. Kuri ; fondos A. Rodriguez. 32 p. in Memín, no. 19 (1983).
notes: SUMMARY: The driver of the luxury car that has knocked Carlos down in the street takes Carlos out for ice cream. The driver is taken aback to learn Carlos's full name: Carlos Arozamena Martínez. The man overpays Carlos for his lost newspapers, and asks for his address, because he has figured out that Carlos is his son. Meanwhile at home Isabel, the mother of Carlos, deals with a difficult customer, who insults her and takes the sewing she has done without paying. Carlos is outraged, but his mother is resigned to her fate. Then Carlos produces the money he has received from his father, and she accepts this fate also. Carlos Arozamena, Senior, lives in a mansion with his overbearing mother and servants. Memín is still grounded and has to stay home helping his mother all day.

133.title: "I Currently Don't Wheeze"
133.author: by Tony Cochran.
notes: Summary: The other kids at school have better clothes, etc., but Agnes has her health.

134.heading: Cochran, Tony.
134.title: "I Don't Need Corrective Shoes"
134.author: T
notes: Summary: Agnes hates her new shoes, and considers telling people they're corrective shoes. But if she lies, God will make it so she needs them.

135.heading: Cochran, Tony.
135.title: "Knock Knock"
135.author: Tony Cochran.
notes: Summary: Agnes, the "hot new quipster" suits her material to the audience.

136.heading: Cochran, Tony.
136.title: "Martha Stewart Would Be Proud"
136.author: by Tony Cochran.
notes: Summary: Grandma makes her wear a dress with a lace collar for the first day at a new school, and Agnes thinks it looks like a doily.

137.heading: Cochran, Tony.
137.title: "This Crummy Dress was a Hot Topic"
137.author: by Tony Cochran.
notes: Summary: Agnes complained about her dress all day at school.

138.heading: Cochran, Tony.
138.title: "Well, She Can Kiss the Kiddie Menu Goodbye"
138.author: by Tony Cochran.
notes: Summary: The waitress offers a placemat and crayons, and Agnes demands oils, linen and grant money.

139.heading: Cochrane, Jim.
139.title: "The Rockets' Red Glare"
139.author: by Lt
139.appears_in: Jim Cochrane ; John Belcastro, art. 8 p. in Wings Comics, no. 116 (1952).
notes: Cover title: "Jet Aces of Korea!"
This is the only appearance of Clipper King, cf. Mougin.

140.heading: Cochran's Corner.
140.title: "Return of the 'Used to' Man : Inaugurating Ex-Warren Editor J.R. Cochran's Column" p. 5 in Comic Book Artist, no. 13
140.author: [No author]
notes: (Cochran's Corner)
(Special issue: The Marvel Horrorshow!)

141.heading: "La Cocina del Diablo" (Sansón) / Powell. 7 p. in Sansón, no.
141.author: [No author]

142.heading: La Cocina Medioeval.
142.title: "De la Epoca de los Caballeros" 3 p. text in Robin Hood, no. 15
142.author: [No author]
notes: Section headings: "La Cocina Medioeval" ; "Leonor de Aquitania" ; "Costumbres Pascuales" ; "El Libro de las Horas."

144.title: "Cocinero" ; p. 39 in Condorito Gigante, no. 418
144.author: [No author]
notes: SUMMARY: Condorito applies for a job at a restaurant, but he can't cook so they offer to buy him some cookbooks, but he can't read. k. Condorito. k. Restaurants. k. Jobs. k. Cooking. k. Cookbooks. k. Reading. k. Literacy. Call no.: PN6790.M44C568no.418

145.title: "El Cocinero"
145.author: [No author]
145.series: Taco y Teco) 4 p. in Durango Kid, no. 49

147.title: Cocaine
notes: Besides the references listed here, the first Kelly Green album, The Go-Between, begins with Kelly's policeman husband getting killed in a cocaine raid gone wrong. The story "Hasta la Vista Amigo" in the album Kraken is about an old friend of the protagonist who has become an addict and is working for cocaine smugglers. In the Condor album L'Otage, it is revealed that the innocent-seeming granddaughter who is ransomed and rescued is actually a cocaine smuggler.
